abstract: Those leaving are Ray Chelstowski, brought in as publisher in January; Tom Weber, the managing editor; and Edward Felsenthal, the executive editor. The departures reflect how much remains unsettled at Newsweek nearly a year after it was bought by Sidney Harman.
snippet: Those leaving are Ray Chelstowski, brought in as publisher in January; Tom Weber, the managing editor; and Edward Felsenthal, the executive editor. The departures reflect how much remains unsettled at Newsweek nearly a year after it was bought by ...
lead_paragraph: 3:15 p.m. | Updated The publisher and two high-ranking editors at Newsweek and The Daily Beast are leaving their jobs, a string of departures that signal distress inside the company as it struggles to turn its fortunes around.

headline.main: Publisher and Two Top Editors Are Out at Newsweek/Daily Beast
